segments.text: I'm hungry . Let's go to the snack bar .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: ok , what unusual food do you want to try ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I am going to try Gado Gado .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: it's a kind of rice ball that is made in Malaysia . What about you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't know . I don't know what most of this food is !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: do you want noodles , vegetables , rice , meat , seafood , beans , or dessert ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'd like to have some vegetables first .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: it's deep fried vegetables , which is commonly eaten in Japan .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: what do you use to eat it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: most people eat tempura with chopsticks , but you can use a fork if you don't know how to use chopsticks .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that sounds great . Do you know if there are any vegetable dishes that are spicy ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: let me think . You could get an Indian or Thai vegetable curry , or you could get some Kimchi .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'll try all of those . How do you know so much about International food ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I used to buy lunch every day from the International food stall at school . Every day was an adventure !
segments.speaker: S1
